class_notes: This course provides an introduction to conducting research in the field of political science. Topics include the selection and development of research questions, conceptualization, measurement, theoretical modeling and ethical concerns in human subjects research. We will also discuss core challenges in drawing causal inferences from data. We will discuss common methods for inferring causation in experimental and observational data. Students have the opportunity to evaluate and design their own research.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 1865, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: Th 8-11a, Instructor: T. Clark, Status: Closed
